solution_line_template: She goes through {bottles_per_month} bottle a month and she likes to stock up for the entire year, which is {months_per_year} months so she needs {bottles_per_month}*{months_per_year} = <<{bottles_per_month}*{months_per_year}={bottles_needed}>>{bottles_needed} bottles

Each bottle is ${cost_per_bottle} and she needs {bottles_needed} bottles so they will cost {cost_per_bottle}*{bottles_needed} = $<<{cost_per_bottle}*{bottles_needed}={total_cost_before_discount}>>{total_cost_before_discount}

The website offers a {discount_percent_num}% discount off of her ${total_cost_before_discount} purchase so the discount will be {discount_percent_decimal}*{total_cost_before_discount} = $<<{discount_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_cost_before_discount}={discount_amount}>>{discount_amount}

Her sunscreen costs ${total_cost_before_discount} and her discount is {discount_amount} making her purchase total {total_cost_before_discount}-{discount_amount} = $<<{total_cost_before_discount}-{discount_amount}={final_cost}>>{final_cost}
